channel.title: Simple FM polysynth patch
channel.description: Here's my first patch based on the FM example. I'm curious if anyone has some advice as to how i'm approaching things. Now that i'm bringing so many parameters to the top-level patcher i'm wondering if there's a way to control the lay-out a liitle more? Maybe have the patch expand horizontally aswell? FM-PolySynth.axp (12.5 KB)

item.title: Simple FM polysynth patch
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

chaosmoon:

i'm wondering if there's a way to control the lay-out a liitle more

Currently not, but this is certainly something that will be addressed in the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple FM polysynth patch
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

When I make something more complex, for example a synth with everything(oscs,, envelopes filters, lfos, effects, etc.. I make a subpatch for each of the parts of the synth. For example one for the oscillators, one for the Lfo, one for the filters, etc. Or if it is really complex make one for each oscillator, one for each filter, effect, etc) This way you can place them in a little bit more meaningfull fashion that when just using one subpatch for the whole instrument.

Colors would be nice for this

Something like this:

Read full topic
